Detailed Description

A helper class derived from WallperEngine for making OpenGL calls.

An internal OpenGL renderer (a rendering thread) will be intialized when this class is created.

Clients typically create their subclasses with implementing functions onGLSurfaceCreated, onGLSurfaceChanged and onGLDrawFrame.

Definition at line 30 of file GLWallpaperEngine.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::service::GLWallpaperEngine::RENDERMODE

Render modes.

Enumerator:
RENDERMODE_WHEN_DIRTY 

The rendering thread only renders when the surface is created, or when requestRender is called.

See also:
getRenderMode()
setRenderMode(int32_t)
requestRender()
RENDERMODE_CONTINUOUSLY 

The rendering thread is called continuously to re-render the scene.

See also:
getRenderMode()
setRenderMode(int32_t)

void gaia::service::GLWallpaperEngine::requestRender ( )

Request that the renderer render a frame.

This method is typically used when the render mode has been set to RENDERMODE_WHEN_DIRTY, so that frames are only rendered on demand. May be called from any thread.

void gaia::service::GLWallpaperEngine::setRenderMode ( int32_t  renderMode)

Set the rendering mode.

When rendering mode is RENDERMODE_CONTINUOUSLY, the renderer is called repeatedly to re-render the scene. When renderMode is RENDERMODE_WHEN_DIRTY, the renderer only rendered when the surface is created, or when requestRender is called. Defaults to RENDERMODE_CONTINUOUSLY.

Using RENDERMODE_WHEN_DIRTY can improve battery life and overall system performance by allowing the GPU and CPU to idle when the scene does not need to be updated.

Parameters:
renderModeone of the RENDERMODE_X constants
See also:
RENDERMODE_CONTINUOUSLY
RENDERMODE_WHEN_DIRTY
